result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Schuster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In lieu of payment, defendant to serve an ADDITIONAL 5 days, consecutive to the 120 days jail and concurrent to any other sentence.

Straight Time.
Apply 64 days sentence credit.

Concurrent with: any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J Schuster

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert J Schuster in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Repeater enhancer is struck.

Court orders the following:
120 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
64 Days Credit.
Concurrent to anyother sentence.

Fine:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid FORTHWITH - In Lieu of payment an additional 5 day consecutive to the 120 Days and Concurrent to anyother sentence.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert J Schuster in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   
Defendant is currently on a PO Hold and pending a revocation hearing on 11/05/15  Hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert J Schuster

Defendant Robert J Schuster in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Robert J Schuster not in court.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in custody and refuses to appear.  Court adjourns to tomorrow.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
